docs.lead_paragraph: Harry Potter swoops around on his broom, faces the bully Malfoy and later runs into a three-headed dog. For scientists studying brain activity while reading, it's the perfect excerpt from the young wizard's many adventures to give their subjects.

docs.lead_paragraph: INA McNEIL can't count the quilts she has made since she began learning the art at age 12, growing up on the Standing Rock Reservation, which straddles South and North Dakota. ''All the women quilted on the reservation,'' said Mrs. McNeil, whose eight-pointed star quilt is featured in ''Quilts: A Window to the Past,'' an exhibition now through June 2 at the Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages here.
docs.abstract: Profile of and interview with Ina McNeil, descendant of Sitting Bull, who comments on significance of quilt Day Break Star, which is featured in quilts exhibition at Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages in Stony Brook; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To help readers better protect themselves from thieves who want to swipe their sensitive debit card information, we've shared pictures in the past of how to spot skimming devices on A.T.M.'s. Skimmers applied to card readers (think fake card readers on top of the real ones) are designed to capture debit card magnetic stripe data, while tiny wireless cameras or overlays to existing personal identification number pads are designed to capture PIN information. Once thieves capture such data, they can use it to make fake cards or sell the information on the Internet to others.
docs.abstract: Bucks blog offers strategies to thwart efforts by thieves to capture debit-card data at automated teller machines (M)
